title: Unusual Ebola strain kills 23 in Uganda; no vaccines, treatments available
description: The Sudan species of Ebolavirus has a fatality rate between 41% and 100%.

title: Better than JPEG? Researcher discovers that Stable Diffusion can compress images
description: Lossy compression bypasses text-to-image portions of Stable Diffusion with interesting results.

title: Apple no longer replacing entire iPad mini 6 just to swap the battery
description: With this one model, you may actually get your iPad back, new battery and all.

title: Meta disrupted China-based propaganda machine before it reached many Americans
description: Networks blocked had dozens of fake accounts from China, thousands from Russia.

title: Apple backtracks, will extend Stage Manager multitasking support to older iPads
description: External display support remains exclusive to M1 iPads, coming "later this year."

title: FCC advances plan to require blocking of spam texts from bogus numbers
description: Robotext plan approved after a year, but FCC still needs to adopt final rules.

title: Early-adopter tax is in full force for the first batch of AM5 motherboards
description: You can spend as much on a board as some people do on their whole PC.

title: Intel: “Moore’s law is not dead” as Arc A770 GPU is priced at $329
description: Expected performance somewhere near Nvidia's RTX 3060 Ti—at least, for DirectX 12.

title: HBO Max drops first teaser for The Last of Us adaptation
description: "You keep her alive, and you set everything right."

title: WoW: Lich King player hits level 80 just 9 hours after “Classic” server launch
description: Bugged boss encounter leads to 9-hour power-leveling run at 1.8 million XP/hour.

title: The Roomba j7+ learns to mop with a dramatic swing-arm setup
description: iRobot's wild mop design can move from the top of the robot to the bottom.

title: Apple Watch Ultra teardown suggests new—but trickier—repair angles
description: Rear access to the Watch Ultra isn't nearly as useful as it was on the iPhone 14.

title: Alienware QD-OLED monitor picks open standards over G-Sync, is $200 cheaper
description: With VESA & AMD certification, the monitor is $200 cheaper than the G-Sync version.

title: Intel’s 13th-gen “Raptor Lake” CPUs are official, launch October 20
description: High-end chips have more cache and cores; laptop and mid-range CPUs come later.

title: Dialing back the bling makes a better EV: The 2023 Mercedes EQE sedan
description: Great aerodynamic efficiency and class-leading infotainment are highlights.

title: Apps can pose bigger security, privacy threat based on where you download them
description: Same app, different risks if you download it in, say, Tunisia rather than in Germany.

title: Nreal’s $380 AR glasses want to be a virtual monitor for MacBooks
description: Air AR glasses add support for M1/M2 MacBooks, an iPhone adapter amid US launch.

title: Ian reaches major hurricane status, will be a historic storm for Florida
description: Surge, winds, rainfall—unfortunately, Hurricane Ian is going to pack quite a punch.
